meanings.definition: A thin, puckered, usually striped cotton fabric commonly used for clothing.
meanings.sent1: I love wearing my seersucker dress on hot summer days.
meanings.sent2: The tailor made a stylish seersucker suit for the wedding.
meanings.sent3: The seersucker fabric felt cool against her skin as she strolled in the park.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as refreshing as a seersucker breeze on a sweltering day.
meanings.sent5: The seersucker pattern reminded him of a gentle wave rolling in the ocean.

meanings.definition: A garment made from seersucker fabric.
meanings.sent1: She admired the elegant seersucker blouse hanging in the store window.
meanings.sent2: He bought a seersucker jacket for the summer barbecue.
meanings.sent3: The seersucker outfit made her feel like a fashion icon at the party.
meanings.sent4: The seersucker dress hugged her figure like a gentle embrace.
meanings.sent5: The seersucker pants added a touch of sophistication to his casual look.

meanings.definition: To gather or pucker in a way resembling seersucker fabric.
meanings.sent1: She tried to seersucker the fabric to create a unique texture.
meanings.sent2: The curtains seersuckered beautifully, adding depth to the room.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to seersucker the paper ended up in a crumpled mess.
meanings.sent4: The flower petals seersuckered together, forming a delicate pattern.
meanings.sent5: The dough seersuckered as she kneaded it, creating a lovely design.
